text: Tagetes moorei is a Mexican species of marigolds in the sunflower family. It is endemic to the states of Hidalgo and Querétaro in central Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1996. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 6. Tageteae and Athemideae. Phytologia Memoirs. 10: i–ii, 1–22, 43–93 ==Description== Tagetes moorei is an perennial herb up to 30 cm (12 inches) tall. Leaves are highly divided, up to 2.5 cm (1.0 inches) long. Flower heads are yellow, each containing about 8 ray florets and 40 or more disc florets.Robinson, Harold Ernest 1973. Phytologia 26(5): 379 description in Latin, commentary and geographic information in English ==References== ==External links== moorei Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Hidalgo (state) Category:Flora of Querétaro Category:Plants described in 1973
title: Tagetes moorei
